title: Web-based video editing website (upload, basic edits, export)

requirements.text: Create a responsive single-page video editor UI that lets users select a local video file, previews it in-browser, and shows an editing workspace with a timeline/trim controls and a properties panel.

quotes: I want to create a website for video editing

acceptanceCriteria: User can choose a video file from their device and see it loaded into a preview player.
UI includes (at minimum) trim controls with start/end times, play/pause, and current time display.
Layout works on desktop and remains usable on mobile (stacked panels or drawer).

requirements.text: Implement basic editing tools that operate on the loaded video and are reflected immediately in the preview: trim (in/out), mute/unmute audio, and playback speed (e.g., 0.5x–2x).

quotes: I want to create a website for video editing

acceptanceCriteria: Adjusting trim in/out updates the effective playback range shown in the preview.
Toggling mute immediately affects preview audio.
Changing playback speed updates preview playback rate and is visible in the UI.

requirements.text: Add an export flow that renders/produces an output video using the current edit settings and provides a downloadable file to the user, with progress indication and graceful error handling.

quotes: I want to create a website for video editing

acceptanceCriteria: User can click an Export button and see export progress (indeterminate or percentage).
On success, the app provides a download link/button for the exported file.
On failure (unsupported codec, export error), the app shows an actionable error message and allows retry.

requirements.text: Add a lightweight backend model for saving and listing editing projects (metadata only), including project name, created/updated timestamps, and the edit settings (trim in/out, mute, playback speed).

quotes: I want to create a website for video editing

acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes methods to create a project, update a project’s edit settings, fetch a project by id, and list projects.
Project data persists across reloads/canister upgrades as permitted by the template defaults (no migration unless state already exists).
Backend stores only metadata/settings (no raw video bytes).

requirements.text: Connect the frontend to the backend so users can name a project, save current edit settings, and reopen a saved project to restore settings in the editor UI.

quotes: I want to create a website for video editing

acceptanceCriteria: User can create/name a project and save current settings.
User can see a list of saved projects and reopen one to restore its settings in the UI.
If backend calls fail, the UI displays an error state and does not lose the currently loaded local video.

requirements.text: Apply a cohesive, creative visual theme for the app (colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) and use it consistently across the landing/editor screens without using a blue/purple primary palette.

quotes: I want to create a website for video editing

acceptanceCriteria: Theme is consistent across navigation, buttons, panels, and forms.
Primary color palette is not blue/purple dominated.
Editor layout has clear visual hierarchy (preview, timeline/controls, properties).

requirements.text: Render the generated static images (logo and hero/illustration) from frontend/public/assets/generated in the UI (e.g., app header/landing area).

quotes: I want to create a website for video editing

acceptanceCriteria: App uses the provided generated image filenames directly from frontend/public/assets/generated.
Images are responsive and do not cause layout shift on load.

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo (no additional backend services).
Do not modify any files under frontend/src/components/ui or any other immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT; compose those components instead.
Do not store or process raw video files on the backend; keep video data client-side.
Use English for any user-facing text.
nonGoals: Advanced professional editing features (multi-track timeline, keyframing, color grading, transitions library, captions/subtitles).
Real-time collaboration, chat, or WebSocket-based sync.
Third-party authentication providers (only Internet Identity would be allowed, but it is not requested here).
External database or external cloud storage for video uploads.

required: Minimal film-strip + scissors logo on transparent background (logo-video-editor.dim_512x512.png)
Wide hero illustration showing a stylized video timeline and playhead (hero-video-editing.dim_1600x600.png)
